headline: How Investors May Respond To Intuit (INTU) Earnings Beat, Capital Returns and New Ad Data Partnership
summary: In November 2025, Intuit reported first-quarter revenue of US$3,885 million and net income of US$446 million, raised its quarterly dividend to US$1.20 per share, completed a US$10.07 billion buyback program launched in 2018, expanded its SMB MediaLabs audiences to The Trade Desk platform, and announced future board and leadership changes. By pairing robust recent earnings with a privacy-focused advertising data partnership that broadens access to millions of verified small-business...
